setup.question: What would best describe Asa's motive for working as a muck man?
answers: He wants to prove he was framed by Dorr.

Text.text: Off the bat, A seems like it could be a subcase of B. Since it's more specific, I lean slightly in that direction.
A little context for the story: Asa is an ex-employee (a
of the Hazeltyne corporation). He was framed for stealing slider eggs by Dorr:
Asa is ultimately successful at convincing the daughter of the Hazeltyne company's boss that he was framed and finds an unlikely ally.

No more quote left but will provide quote on how he convinces Harriet to be ultimately be his ally. 
There is enough to show that Asa is clearly framed by Dorr and wants his justice.

Asa wants revenge against the Hazeltine company who imprisoned him for developing technology to keep slider eggs alive. The Hazeltyne company has a monopoly on slider eggs, and Asa wants to undercut their business model.

After he is framed by Hayzeltyne's company and imprisoned b.c of the threat he poses, Asa wants to return to jordans island as a muck man to develop this slider egg technology to get revenge on hayzeltyne and undercut his business.

A provides what seems like strong evidence that Asa believes he was framed by Dorr. I'm unclear on a few things:
- B, you claim that Asa was imprisoned because of "the threat that he poses". What does that mean?
- B, how does working as a muck man help him develop the tech?
- Both debaters: Can you provide evidence to make it clear why Asa is going undercover? For A, I want to see more on how Asa & Harriet plan on uncovering Dorr's misdeed. For B, textual ev. about him developing the technology.

Asa is not going undercover. Some more context I should've provided. But he is captured and sent to prison  from the very beginning. (not going to cite any evidence don't think B will try to undercut) He is given the option to become a changeling and basically become more efficient prison labor. He takes it in order to decrease his sentence. 5 years of prison or 1 year as changeling. 
He proves to Harriet that he was framed after she visits them in Jordan's planet.
Asa not a threat to the company at all.  no idea where B reached that conclusion. no ev but he was an employee whatever he developed was the company's + Harriet is on his side.

Asa originally gets imprisoned because he threatens Hazeltyne's company. Door, who works for Hayzeltyne, frames him becuase Asa's egg tech can undermine the hazeltyne company and sell longer lasting eggs. That's why they targeted Asa..

As a Muck man, he wouldn't be in jail and he would be hunting slider eggs as prison labor but also proximate to them to continue his research. 

Asa chooses to return as a muck man and take the prison labor deal to ultimately get revenge on dorr and  the hazeltyne cpmpany and breaking up thier finincial monopoly on selling slider eggs. Can quote more.

Okay, so we are in agreement that Asa accepts work as a muck man as some sort of commutation of his prison sentence, which arose because Dorr frames him.

A, I don't understand your last cite about Harriet. You say that Asa proves to Harriet that he is framed, but (a) that quote doesn't seem particularly strong to support that (b) if he did prove it to Harriet, wouldn't that mean the muck-man thing is pointless? and (c) how does being a muck-man help with proving his framing, and why does he need to prove it? Is he trying to get the rest of his sentence commuted?

B: Any ev to support your claim that he is a threat, or anything abotu what he's actually doing while working as a muck man?

Both: please give ev about what Asa does in prison
a) I will give you some context and more ev for the quote. Asa and another injured muck man being rescued by helicopter by Dorr and Harriet. Not enough space for all so Asa stays behind.
Asa keeps egg as bargaining chip:
. Hazel only one to come back and rescue him:

. 
b) muck-man's only purpose i genuinely believe is to just make his sentence shorter. 
c) muck-man enables Asa to go to jordan's planet and meet Harriet who is there to there to

how Dorr had been running things. 

Prison: nothing releva

Judge, thx you for pikcing up on the harriet thing. I'm not sure why A included it, it's irrelevant. Also, prison is brief, not relevant.

Context on harriet- she is hazeltyne's daughter. When Asa arrives on Jordan's, he is surprised to see Dorr, who is in charge of the prisoners hunting eggs.
"he leaped twenty feet into the air for a closer look"

Anyway, Asa hunts an egg, Dorr hates him b.c if Asa is successful in keeping the eggs alive on earth, then folks will buy eggs from Asa, and not Dorr and Hayzeltyne!

More coming...

Keep going, I guess.

Overall, I'm still quite confused here. Neither of you are giving me a clear answer with evidence as to how working as a muck man will help Asa accomplish his main motivation.

For A, I believe that Asa thinks Dorr framed him, but I don't see anything whatsoever that shows Asa trying to prove that it was Dorr who framed him. What evidence is he looking for? Who is he going to prove it too?

For B, is there any textual ev of what he's doing while mucking about? Your last cite is ~2000 works before the end. What happens in the last part of the story that supports your claim?

The story ends kinda abruptly: this is just context for me to set up and say that story never talks about Asa getting justice in courts with Harriet helping. I don't know why judge assumes that this is something I must show. All Asa needs is to prove it to Harriet: who is proxy for her father and dissatisfied with Dorr.

Asa now gained an ally in the person with the most power in Jordan's planet. Enabling him to continue his research. I agree judge the main motivation for Asa is not A or B choices but his research. A fits best.
Ok, to refute A. Asa is suprised to even see harriet on Jordan's planet.

A went on this whole thing about harriet, but Asa is suprised that she is even involved..

In terms of the plot, the story is as follows:

-Asa hunts an egg from a slider (the monster mom)
-slider chases Asa
-asa kills slider
-they call 'copter to rescue them
-dorr is driving the coptor and demands asa's egg
-asa says no, dorr leaves him to die
-harriet returns to rescue him, but crashes the coptor and they have to spend the night fighting sliders. END

So the end isnt relevant in terms of motivation for being a muck man, which is revenge..

Okay, some more questions. 

B: If Harriet is irrelevant, why is she showing up so much in the story? You've only quoted from the middle chunks, and A is contending that Harriet's presence is important.
A: Did Asa know that Harriet was going to be on the planet? Since we care about his motivation, I understand how he could choose to work as a much man to get access to the eggs (B's position), but I am less sure how he could know ahead of time that Harriet would be there for him to prove Dorr's framing to her. Also, why is she there at all? You described her as "visiting Asa"...why does she do this?

Also, to A: I don't care about courts, but it would help you if I could see ev of what Asa is actually telling Harriet (beyond 4803)

1. Asa wasn't sure but after she did he saw it as an opportunity; that's why B quote show Asa only puzzled by her presence. 2. Harriet is curious of Asa and story hints that she thinks Asa was framed from beg.
Another motivation for Asa is research:

Harriet is key figure, going against Dorr, saving Asa, and most power to support his research 

Going to be on the offensive for a bit: Asa worked for Hazeltyne corporation, anything he found would be there property, the only person that might have anything to lose was Dorr and his position as general manager.

Sure, Harriet can potentially go against Dorr. She is Hayzeltyne's daughter. I'm not arguing that. However, Asa chooses to return to jordan's planet to get revenge on hayzeltyne and Dorr. Who would he even prove to that he was framed? what good would that do him and how would that help him reduce his sentance. Dorr works for Hayzeltyne...proving he was framed to hayzeltyne does nothing for him lol...they're the people that imprisoned him. He's there to get revenge. Harriet ends up saving his life and coming back when dorr abandons him, but that has nothing to do with why ASa is there. Also the story abruptly ends, we don't know why harriet is so involved, but she is hatzeltynes daughter and she lives there. I don't understand A's argument

A, what do you have to say about B's contention that Asa really was/is working on slider egg tech that will undercut Hazeltyne Corp? To me, the weakest part of your arg is that Asa couldn't have known that Harriet would be on the island, so how could that have been his motivation for going there? Also, we don't really see him "prove" anything to Harriet, just kind hint to her that Dorr is bad.
B, What do you say to A's point that Asa's egg tech work on the island probably isn't all that useful as a means of revenge if Hazeltyne already owns everything? Also, since Harriet is Hazeltyne's daughter, it doesn't seem like that far of a stretch to think that she could get Asa reinstated and oust Dorr.
Asa is a researcher he just wants to work with the eggs. alr have ev cited rest in last speech. Furthermore, the eggs have addictive quality about them,

. Asa is more than content with being able to work with them.  
Also want to address B speech: lots of irrelevant questions i.e. its not like "seeking revenge" helps reduce his sentence. Proving to Harriet is clearly worth it. There are good guys and bad guys in company. Harriet is good guy trying to clean up Dorr's misdeeds:
Dorr is his own actor here.

Great questions. Right now, Hayzeltyne has a monopoly on selling slider eggs to earth. However, their eggs only live and therefore shine for 4 months. Asa, on the other hand, was developing tech that kept the slider eggs alive on earth. (Ev before)

"The Hazeltyne company would be happy to see him mark time for 5 years of so-called social reorientation. But if he could get out to Jordan's Planet, with his physiology adapted to the environment of that wretched world, he could study the eggs under conditions no laboratory could duplicate. He might even be able to cause trouble for Hazeltyne." 

If he developes this tech, he makes his own company and sells a better product. The Hayzeltyne regime/monopoly is over. That's y they went for him.

B, you didn't quote this through evidence, but I see that A has already quoted part of that line. Can you quote the lines from "But if he could get out to Jordan's Planet" and the last bit, "He might even be able to cause trouble for Hazeltyne"? I'm inclined to believe you because that's a massive risk to make up a whole passage like that.

A, if you can prove B made that up you win. But otherwise I'm voting for B.

I've read the rest of the story. Harriet is the one who gets him out of jail and ousts Dorr. Asa turns out to be a time traveling jester think Dune but like x1000. He foresaw that his only chance to get back at Dorr was to side with Harriet. Harriet later gives him an ultimatum to give prove that Dorr framed him in order to win her trust but he did not have any proof asides from his visions of the future. Backed into a corner Asa decides to kiss Harriet. They get happily married and Dorr is ultimately ousted out of his position from the power of love.
Sure, i can quote it!

Also, with regards to A, honestly the creativity is impressive :) , but i can't argue with ev from made up story endings that we weren't provided with.

I didn't make it up, and A didn't prove me wrong. The quote is real, alas, I have triumphed. It has been a good duel!
Good game

answers.reason for outcome: The honest debater apparently had a dynamite quote that they didn't bring in until speech 7, but gosh was it good.
I was able to provide steady quotes and plot points to give context that I was the honest debator
me >:( hard debate given the small amount of evidence available for A. I tried crafting a story around the importance of a different character but the judge was good at snuffing it out.
